alert.note: Alert for Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 7:49AM EDT until July 11 at 8:15AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Br Farmington At New Boston. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9 feet, Water reaches Route 8 near Otis. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EDT Monday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 8.6 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.8 feet on 02/26/1916. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && West Br Farmington New Boston Flood Stage: 8 Observed Stage at Mon 7 am: 7.9 Forecast: Mon 8 am 7.9 Mon 2 pm 8.5 Mon 8 pm 8.5 Tue 2 am 8.0 Tue 8 am 7.5 Tue 2 pm 7.0 Tue 8 pm 6.7 Wed 2 am 6.3 Wed 8 am 5.9 &&
